titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the John M. Meek Collection 1934/1999
titlepage.publisher: Carl Albert Center Congressional and Political Collections

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Carl Albert Center Congressional and Political Collections

bioghist.head: Biographical Information:
bioghist.p: A native Oklahoman of Choctaw ancestry, John Martin Meek was one of the most successful public relations counselors in the Washington, D.C., area from 1969 to his relocation to Arizona in 1999. Following high school graduation, he served in the U.S. Navy and saw action during the Korean Conflict. After completing his military career, he attended the University of Oklahoma and graduated with a degree in journalism in 1958. He also received a master's degree from Syracuse University. During his newspaper career, he worked on newspapers in Oklahoma, Texas, and New York. In 1959, he became manager of the Community Development Department for the U.S. Junior Chamber of Commerce. Following the election of President John F. Kennedy, Meek moved to Washington where he served as press secretary to U.S. Senator Robert S. Kerr of Oklahoma. Following Kerr's unexpected death in 1963, he held the same position with Senator J. Howard Edmondson who was appointed to succeed Kerr.

During the 1964 Democratic National Convention, Meek was the assistant to the publicity director. In 1965, he held a similar position for the presidential inaugural. Shortly thereafter, he moved to the Democratic National Committee (DNC) and served as the director of congressional relations. As the chief liaison between the DNC and all Democratic members of Congress, he was involved in numerous activities related to the day-to-day operations of congressional offices. He became coordinator for the 1968 Democratic National Convention held in Chicago. In this position, he was responsible for many of the arrangements necessary for conducting the event.

Following the convention, he became a public relations counselor in Washington, D.C. During his years in the nation's capital, he was involved in numerous projects. In the late 1980s, he served as the counselor to the state of Arizona in its quest to become the site of the Superconducting Super Collider. He also worked on major national public education programs in health care for Glaxo Wellcome.

Since 1999, Meek has lived in Tucson, Arizona, where he continues to write and consult. He also is an adjunct professor at Pima Community College. His first novel, The Christmas Hour, is slated for publication in late 2002.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use:
userestrict.p: The University of Oklahoma asserts no claim of copyright over photographs in this collection taken by private citizens. Any publication of such photographs requires the consent of the copyright holder.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of Materials:
arrangement.p: This collection contains 4 series: Manuscripts, Oversize, Maps, and Photographs. The Manuscripts series is arranged alphabetically then chronologically by year, month, and day. The Oversized series is arranged into two groups: three-dimensional ephemera, paper ephemera. The Photographs series is arranged generally by year and grouped by event or content.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The John M. Meek Collection is a small collection which includes material on aspects of the organization of the 1968 Democratic National Convention, from hotel accommodations to first aid and security to requests from committees and entertainers to appear at the convention. While there is a copy of the proceedings of the convention, there is little else in the papers that relates to the event as it occurred. Most materials concern preliminary preparations for the convention. A small photograph collection is also included in the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence: convention facilities; Chicago's bid agreements; data.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Candidates; civil liberties; Vietnam; Democratic Party platform; protesters, national anthem.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lists of state delegates and alternates.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: List of committee chairmen; telephone numbers of state delegations' headquarters; account information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Call for meetings; lists of committee members; speech (unknown speaker); dinner invitations to committee members; committee member schedules; committee member reservations; committee meeting minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Speech by John M. Bailey; allotted votes and delegates per state delegation; reservations for committee meetings; meeting agendas; schedules and calendars; committee resolutions; activity reports by John M. Meek; biographical sketch of John M. Meek.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Chicago students and volunteer participation; proclamation from Chicago Sun-Times, Chicago Daily News; correspondence with state delegates; receipts; committee accounts with hotels; United Democrats for Humphrey; possible demonstrations; statement by Sen. Eugene McCarthy; Booklet: Temporary Roll of Delegates and Alternates to the Democratic National Convention.

did.unittitle: Democratic National Committee, Committee on Credentials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Credentials, design; convention badges; minority reports on Credentials Committee; list of Democratic congressmen; Credentials Committee and civil rights.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Media requirements for coverage of convention; agenda for the meeting of representatives of the news media and communications services; schedule of conference.

did.unittitle: Democratic National Committee, Media Conference, Stenographic Report

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Report of the proceedings of December 7, 1967.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Memos concerning work space and housing, delegations, volunteers, new staff; John Meek's activities; information and suggestions on office services; convention identification and tickets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Press releases concerning the allocation of delegates; Chicago convention site; street crime; Lyndon B. Johnson. (1967-July 1968).

did.unittitle: Democratic National Committee, Press Releases, Aug.-Sept

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Headquarter space for candidates; work space and housing; convention session schedules; Carl Albert; Chicago host committee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Travel reservations for Site Committee; lists of committee members; committee reports.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Arrangements for meetings; schedule of Site Selection Committee meeting; Committee travel schedules.

did.unittitle: Democratic National Committee, Site Committee, Meeting Transcript

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Requests by organizations to appear before the committee, including American Congress for Irish Freedom, National Federation of Independent Business, National Council on Crime and Delinquency, National Association of Life Underwriters, and Veterans of Foreign Wars; correspondence concerning a bill of rights for victims of crime and electoral college reform; work space for committee; lists of committee members. (1967-Mar. 1968)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Requests by organizations to appear before the committee, including Women's International League for Peace and Freedom, National Council of the Churches of Christ, National Federation of Settlements and Neighborhood Centers, American Israel Public Affairs Committee, National Council of Farmer Cooperatives, Association of American Medical Colleges, Business Executives Move for Vietnam Peace, Paralyzed Veterans of America, Inc., National Canners Association, Sierra Club, National Federation of Federal Employees, Federation of American Scientists; correspondence from World Association of Mothers for Peace, Inc.; Carl Albert; public hearings; meeting schedules; copy of the 1968 platform of the Democratic Party.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence asking for work or appointment at the Democratic National Convention. Referrals included.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence concerning musical entertainment, honorary speakers, fireworks; 1964 Democratic National Convention Program; requests to add special events to program. (1967-Mar. 1968)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence concerning musical entertainment, honorary attendees, special events. Among the correspondents are Charles C. Diggs and John Conyers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence concerning arrangements for food service at convention.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Telephone requirements for Democratic National Committee at Hilton Hotel; International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers strike.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Insurance requirements at the International Amphitheatre.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lighting, sound, and basic facilities for convention and press.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence concerning miscellaneous items that were produced solely for the convention, including posters, buttons, ribbons, dress for pages; purple badge from the 1952 Democratic National Convention for the Assistant Sergeant At Arms.

did.unittitle: Office Equipment and Furnishings, Decoration and Services

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence from companies offering services and products; lists of requirements; orders from companies. (1967-1968 Jan.)

did.unittitle: Office Equipment and Furnishings, Decoration and Services, Feb.-May

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence from companies offering services and products; orders from companies.

did.unittitle: Office Equipment and Furnishings, Decoration and Services, June-Aug

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence from companies offering services and products; orders from companies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Convention press kit; correspondence concerning coverage of convention from United Press, International, Life, Chicago Sun-Times, and WGN.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence concerning the responsibility of Democratic National Committee and the city of Chicago concerning security; various security companies offering their services and products; turnstiles; fencing; identification; tickets; arrangements for "security rooms" for the President, Vice-President, and Sen. Eugene McCarthy; riot control issues; Timothy Leary; Allen Ginsberg; Hippies; Yippies; Black Panthers; statement from Richard J. Daley.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, maps, and proposals dealing with the Site Selection Committee meeting in Houston to explore the possibility of Houston for the 1968 Democratic National Convention; list of persons "instrumental in hosting the Democratic Site Committee" visit; committee itinerary. (1966-April 1967)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, maps, and proposals dealing with the Site Selection Committee meeting to explore the possibility of Houston as the site for the 1968 Democratic National Convention.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and invitations dealing with the Site Selection Committee meeting to explore the possibility of Las Vegas as the site for the 1968 Democratic National Convention; correspondents include Howard W. Cannon and Alan Bible.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, maps, plans, and proposals dealing with the Site Selection Committee meeting to explore the possibility of Los Angeles as the site for the 1968 Democratic National Convention; resolution from the County of Los Angeles Board of Supervisors to invite the convention to Los Angeles; correspondents include Sam Yorty, mayor of Los Angeles

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, plans, and proposals dealing with the Site Selection Committee meeting to explore the possibility of Miami Beach as the site for the 1968 Democratic National Convention; issue of state of Florida being placed under professional sanctions by the Florida Education Association and the National Education Association; correspondents include Charles E. Bennett and Claude R. Kirk, Jr. (governor of Florida).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials in Folders 20-25 were donated to the Carl Albert Center in the Summer of 2009 by John M. Meek.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes vice presidential acceptance speech by Edmund S. Muskie titled "Working for Freedom" and presidential acceptance speech by Hubert H. Humphrey titled "A New Day for America." Materials in Folders 20-25 were donated to the Carl Albert Center in the Summer of 2009 by John M. Meek.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials in Folders 20-25 were donated to the Carl Albert Center in the Summer of 2009 by John M. Meek.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes One Nation, One People: Democratic Platform, 1964; press kit for the Inaugural Committee, 1965; official inaugural program, January 20, 1965; The Democrat, April-May 1968; and Among Friends of LBJ, April 30, 1999. Materials in Folders 20-25 were donated to the Carl Albert Center in the Summer of 2009 by John M. Meek.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes biographical sketch and notes written after the 1968 Democratic National Convention. Materials in Folders 20-25 were donated to the Carl Albert Center in the Summer of 2009 by John M. Meek.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes contract with the city of Miami Beach, Florida; and badges for convention. Materials in Folders 20-25 were donated to the Carl Albert Center in the Summer of 2009 by John M. Meek.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Boxes 4, 5, and 6 were donated to the Carl Albert Center in the Summer of 2009 by John M. Meek
